document_id.description: Document the entry is related to. This relation is set by an account billing.

item_id.description: Line item on the document the entry is related to. This relation is set by an account billing or when a document is booked onto an account.

price_single.description: Net price of a single entry. If a product id is given, price_single is taken from the product if not set.

net_total.description: Net price of a single entry. Calculated from price_single * quantity

quantity_unit.description: Quantity unit e.g: kg, days, month, ..

date.description: Date of the entry. Defaults to today. Entries are sorted by date per default.

billable.description: True if the entry can be billed.

billed_at.description: Date the object was billed. Automatically set when the entry is used on an invoice.

created_at.description: Date the object was created. Never changes afterwards

_destroy.description: When set an existing entry will be deleted. This switch is used for entries passed during batch operations.

page.title: Page
page.description: In paginated results set the page to look for

per_page.title: Per page
per_page.description: Results per page. Default is 50, max is 200

filter[account_ids].title: Search by related accounts
filter[account_ids].description: Set multiple account ids comma separated or as array

filter[document_ids].title: Search by related documents
filter[document_ids].description: Set multiple document ids comma separated or as array

filter[ids].title: Search by account entry ids
filter[ids].description: Set multiple entry ids comma separated or as array

filter[unbilled].title: Unbilled
filter[unbilled].description: Entries available for billing: marked as billable without a billing date(billed_at) set. False values will skip this filter. To find billed entries simply use filter[billed_at_to] e.g with todays date.

filter[billable].title: Billable
filter[billable].description: Billable or not billable entries. Set false(string) or 0(Integer) to get not billable entries. For billable entries use true or 1. Also see filter[unbilled] to find not yet billed entries.

filter[date_from].title: From date
filter[date_from].description: Objects with a date eq/after the date. YYYY-MM-DD

filter[date_to].title: To date
filter[date_to].description: Objects with date eq/before the date. YYYY-MM-DD

filter[billed_at_from].title: From billing date
filter[billed_at_from].description: Objects with a billing date eq/after the date. YYYY-MM-DD

filter[billed_at_to].title: To billing date
filter[billed_at_to].description: Objects with billing date eq/before the date. YYYY-MM-DD. A set billing date means the entry has been billed, so simply use this filter e.g with date today to find all billed entries.

filter[created_at_from].title: From creation date
filter[created_at_from].description: Objects with a date eq/after the date. YYYY-MM-DD

filter[created_at_to].title: To creation date
filter[created_at_to].description: Objects with a creation until the date(<=). ISO 8601 format YYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+z or just a date YYY-MM-DD. If date is given the time is set to the end of the day(23:59:59) so all objects created on that day are included. A time should be already utc time.

sort_by.title: Sort by
sort_by.description: Sort the results by the given field => number

sort.title: Sort
sort.description: Sort the results in ASC or DESC
